resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/105186</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>105186</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206383</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">American Journeys</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Amerikanische Reisen</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Voyages Américains</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Viagens Americanas</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Viaggi Americani</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αμερικανικά ταξίδια</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Viajes Americanos</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">provides eyewitness accounts of North American exploration, from the Vikings in Canada (1000) to the diaries of mountain men (1800). Read the words of ship captains, fur traders, Indians, missionaries, and settlers as they lived through the founding moments of American history. Highlights include Christopher Columbus stepping ashore (1492), Indians' first resistance (1493), Pilgrims landing in Plymouth (1620), and Pocahontas rescuing John Smith (1607).</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">stellt Augenzeugekonten der nordamerikanischen 
Erforschung, vom Vikings in Kanada (1000) zu den Tagebüchern der 
Gebirgsmänner zur Verfügung (1800). Lesen Sie die Wörter der 
Schiff Kapitäne, der Pelzhändler, der Inder, der Missionare und der 
Siedleren, wie sie durch die gründenmomente der amerikanischen 
Geschichte lebten. Höhepunkte enthalten Christopher Columbus an
Land (tritt 1492), erster Widerstand der Inder (1493), die Pilgrims, 
die in Plymouth (1620) landen und Pocahontas, das, das John Smith 
(1607) rettet.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">fournit des comptes de témoin oculaire 
d'exploration américaine du nord, du Vikings au Canada (1000) aux
agendas des hommes de montagne (1800). Lisez les mots des 
capitaines de bateau, des commerçants de fourrure, des Indiens, des 
missionnaires, et des colons comme ils ont vécu par les moments de 
fondation de l'histoire américaine. Les points culminants 
incluent Christopher Columbus faisant un pas à terre (1492), 
résistance des Indiens la première (1493), les pélerins débarquant
dans Plymouth (1620), et le Pocahontas sauvant John Smith (1607).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">fornece clientes da testemunha ocular da 
exploração norte-americana, do Vikings em Canadá (1000) aos 
diários dos homens da montanha (1800). Leia as palavras de 
capitães do navio, de comerciantes da pele, de indians, de 
missionários, e de settlers como viveram com os momentos fundando do 
history americano. Os destaques incluem Christopher Columbo que 
pisa em terra (1492), resistência dos indians' a primeira (1493), os 
pilgrims que aterram em Plymouth (1620), e o Pocahontas que salva John
Smith (1607).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">fornisce i clienti del testimone oculare di 
esplorazione nordamericana, dal Vikings nel Canada (1000) ai diari 
degli uomini della montagna (1800). Legga le parole dei capitani
della nave, dei commercianti della pelliccia, degli indiani, dei 
missionari e dei settlers come hanno vissuto con i momenti fondanti 
di storia americana. I punti culminanti includono Christopher 
Columbus che fa un passo a secco (1492), resistenza degli indiani 
prima (1493), pilgrims che atterrano in Plymouth (1620) e Pocahontas 
che salva John Smith (1607).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">παρέχει τις περιγραφές αυτοπτών μαρτύρων της 
βορειοαμερικανικής εξερεύνησης, από τους Βίκινγκ στον Καναδά 
(1000) στα ημερολόγια των ατόμων βουνών (1800). 
Διαβάστε τις λέξεις των καπετάνιων σκαφών, των εμπόρων 
γουνών, Ινδών, των ιεραποστόλων, και των αποίκων όπως έζησαν 
μέσω των στιγμών ίδρυσης της αμερικανικής ιστορίας. Τα 
κυριώτερα σημεία περιλαμβάνουν Χριστόφορο Κολόμβος που περπατούν
στην ξηρά (1492), την πρώτη αντίσταση Ινδών (1493), τους 
προσκυνητές που προσγειώνονται στο Πλύμουθ (1620), και 
Pocahontas που διασώζουν John Smith (1607).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">proporciona a cuentas del testigo presencial de la
exploración norteamericana, del Vikings en Canadá (1000) a los 
diarios de los hombres de la montaña (1800). Lea las palabras 
de los capitanes de la nave, de los comerciantes de la piel, de los 
indios, de los misionarios, y de los colonos como vivieron con los 
momentos de fundación de la historia americana. Los toques de 
luz incluyen a Christopher Columbus que camina en tierra (1492), 
resistencia de los indios la primera (1493), los peregrinos que 
aterrizan en Plymouth (1620), y Pocahontas que rescata a Juan Smith 
(1607).</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206383</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>105186</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/american-journeys</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
